channel.title: OpenAI on Beachgeek blog - a refuge for pineapple on pizza lovers
channel.description: Recent content in OpenAI on Beachgeek blog - a refuge for pineapple on pizza lovers

item.title: Unboxing Ragna: Getting hands on and making it to work with Amazon Bedrock
item.description: Unboxing Ragna: Getting hands on and making it to work with Amazon Bedrock I am always on the look out for interesting new projects to check out, and this week I came across Ragna, an open source Retrieval Augmented Generation RAG orchestration framework. It is a new project with a committed and active community, so I wanted to find out more about this project. What piqued my interest was reading this blog post, Unveiling Ragna: An Open Source RAG-based AI Orchestration Framework Designed to Scale From Research to Production which takes a look at the background, or as I like to think of it, the “scratch that needed to be itched”.

item.title: Getting gnarly with AI - a quick look at Griptape, an enterprise ready alternative to LangChain
item.description: Getting started with Griptape Getting gnarly with AI When I was much much younger, I was known to (very occasionally) drop an ollie, kick-turn, or very occasionally dare a drop in on my trusty skateboard. Thanks to the grip tape, my shoes would stick to the board, and gave me the confidence I could try these tricks. I was always grateful to that grip tape and who knew all these years later, I would become re-aquatinted with it (albeit in a different form!
